What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_List:
I become more interested in astronomy and my dream major is astronomy.
I get to know many things about the universe.
I developed my math skills and acquired in depth knowledge about the universe
Greater understanding of fundamental astronomy and the methods used to construct/calculate our models of the universe.
I realized my enjoyment of astronomy. I learned how to apply my knowledge to different problems without being given a set way to solve a set type of problem.
From the course, I gained the basic knowledge of astronomy.
The course arrangement is a little bit busy. Maybe the professor need to talk faster.

Strengths: very detailed course, the teacher actually explained things in detail so that I understood the logic behind every formula and theory
Weaknesses: a lot of work
This course was challenging and interesting, and difficulty of problem sets was easily justified by their informativeness and lack of repetitive problems.
The course is a little bit too easy for university students, even for a freshman. It should be taught in a more difficult and challenging way.

Definitely!
It is a really good course to get to know the universe!

I would recommend it to students that are interested in science because this course will greatly expand their understanding of physics. But for students that prefer social sciences this course in my opinion would be too much.
I would recommend this to another student who is interested in mathematics and astronomy, as it is enjoyable and provides a high level of understanding of the fundamental principles of astronomy.
Yes because even if you have little prior knowledge you can take and enjoy it.
I would recommend it to a high school student but not to a university student.
